definition: to live up to expectations (idiom)
(negative prefix)/not/no
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
many/numerous/crowd/multitude
variant of 眾|众[zhong4]
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]

sentences.english: The Chinese men dominated on their home soil, as expected.
sentences.chinese: 中国男子体操队不负众望在本土取得霸主地位。

sentences.english: The soldier's performance of his duties was as good as one might expect.
sentences.chinese: 这位士兵不负众望，出色地履行了自己的职责。

sentences.english: In the hope of so many people, you did not let us down.
sentences.chinese: 在这么多人的希冀下，你不负众望。

sentences.english: Uruguay lived up to its reputation and delighted the home fans by disposing of one team after another.
sentences.chinese: 乌拉圭队不负众望过关斩将，乡亲们都非常高兴。

sentences.english: The bravest man in the village successfully completed his mission of killing the ferocious beast.
sentences.chinese: 村里最勇敢的人终于不负众望杀死了那头老虎。

definition: fame follows merit (idiom)
people's expectations
to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist/unremitting efforts
as expected
one's contributions cannot go unnoticed (idiom)
everyone present applauds/universal acclaim/a standing ovation/to bring the house down
to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
not living up to expectations (idiom)/failing to inspire confidence among people/unpopular
to have one's wish fulfilled
to win/to be victorious/to report a victory
laurel/victory garland (in Greek and Western culture)
remarkable (performance, achievement etc)/worthy of praise
to seize total victory (idiom); an overwhelming victory/to win by a landslide (in election)
to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success) (idiom)/abbr. for 過五關斬六將|过五关斩六将[guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4]
to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
